strings.Value: "What happened, Linzi?"
"Just take some time to catch your breath and explain what happened."
"I don't have time to spare for your nonsense."
"What happened here?"
"This is... unexpected."
"Who did this?!"
"In your opinion, where should I begin this investigation?"
"Oh, if I manage to catch this thief…"
"Time to get going."
"What were my guards doing?!"
{n}Linzi's eyes glitter and her nostrils flare with rage, but for some reason she speaks in a whisper.{/n} "Such... such insolence! Such unforgettable, monstrous, unimaginable insolence!"
{n}Linzi suddenly and firmly grabs your sleeve.{/n} "Nonsense? How can it be nonsense if Your Royal Highness now has no place to, pardon my language, sit {mf|his|her} royal ass on?!"
"The throne... The royal throne... It..." {n}Linzi stops whispering and silently points her finger to the far side of the throne room.{/n}

{n}Linzi catches her breath and continues to whisper,{/n} "Your Highness, we've got a problem. A major problem. Look for yourself!" {n}The bard points her finger toward the far side of the throne room.{/n}
{n}You raise your eyes. The place where the royal throne once stood is now empty.{/n}
{n}Linzi shrugs.{/n} "The culprit managed to escape, but I can't imagine how someone could drag the throne out of the palace without being noticed by anyone!"
"Insidious, shameless robbery — that's what happened here! Who would even think to break into the royal chambers!"
"I'm surprised by your self-control: if I were you, I'd go on a rampage! Shameless scum, how could they go and rob the royal palace with the {mf|king|queen} still alive and well!"

"In fact, our case is blatant and extraordinary, but hardly exceptional. Word on the streets is that the local population has become sick and tired of thieves — they break into people's homes, bypass the locks and latches, and steal everything they can! And now the scum has the guts to meddle with royal property!"

"We need to sort this out before they steal the whole kingdom one brick at a time... and we need to get back your throne! It's shameful!" {n}Linzi regains control of herself and continues in a low whisper.{/n} "I really hope your people here won't go wagging their tongues and spreading filthy rumors."
"You should start with interrogating potential witnesses! I think the captain of the guard was in the palace when it happened — he was the one who discovered the throne was missing, at least!"

"Then you should go to the city. I heard the smith was robbed recently too. Maybe he can give you some clues? Also, if I were you, I'd talk to the trader — he might have some hints as to who may be selling stolen goods. Oh, and one more thing — don't forget to visit the innkeeper. Who better to glean information from any troubled locals finding themselves in need of a shoulder to cry on?"
{n}Linzi shakes her head.{/n} "Whatever your upcoming plans were, retrieving the throne must be your top priority! I dread to think how loud our neighbors will laugh if they learn of this disgrace!"

{n}Linzi flings her arms up.{/n} "Well, you weren't on the throne at the time it was stolen, right? And our guards are trained to guard people, not furniture!" {n}The bard gives you a faint smile.{/n} "Sure, if the throne was stolen with you still sitting on it, things would be much worse. That's not much consolation, though..."
